questions.question_text: The angle of elevation of the top of a tower from a point O on the ground, which is 450 m away from the foot of the tower, is 40°. Find the height of the tower.
hints: Use trigonometric ratio tan θ = opposite/adjacent
Draw a right triangle with tower as vertical side
Apply h = d × tan θ where d = 450m, θ = 40°

questions.question_text: Explain the Konigsberg bridge problem and why it was impossible to walk through the town crossing each bridge exactly once in the original configuration.
hints: Consider the network representation with vertices and arcs
Count the degree (number of arcs) at each vertex
Recall Euler's theorem about odd vertices

questions.question_text: After an extra bridge was built joining river banks A and B in Konigsberg, is it possible to go around the city using each bridge exactly once? Explain why.
hints: Draw the modified network with new bridge
Recalculate degrees of vertices A, B, C, D
Check Euler's condition for existence of Euler path

questions.question_text: A farm house uses atleast 800 kg of special food daily. The special food is a mixture of corn and soyabean with the following compositions: Corn (Protein: 0.09/kg, Fibre: 0.02/kg, Cost: Rs 10/kg), Soyabean (Protein: 0.60/kg, Fibre: 0.06/kg, Cost: Rs 20/kg). The dietary requirements stipulate atleast 30% protein and at most 5% fibre. Determine the daily minimum cost of the food mix.
hints: Define variables: x = corn amount, y = soyabean amount
Objective: Minimize z = 10x + 20y
Solve graphically or using linear programming

questions.question_text: Suppose a population control unit wants to find out how many people will be there in a certain country after 10 years. Given current population is 250,000,000, birth rate b = 0.02, and death rate d = 0.01. Calculate the population after 10 years using the exponential growth model P(t) = P(0)(1 + b - d)^t.
hints: Calculate growth rate r = 1 + b - d
Use approximation since population must be integer

questions.question_text: Describe the four main steps involved in mathematical modelling process with reference to the simple pendulum example.
hints: Identify the steps: Formulation, Solution, Interpretation, Validation
For pendulum: Parameters (T, l, g), equation T = 2π√(l/g)
Compare calculated vs experimental values
Interpret physical meaning of relationship

questions.question_text: Explain why the mathematical model for population growth P(t) = P(0)r^t gives fractional population values and how we handle this in interpretation.
hints: Model assumes continuous growth but population is discrete
Fractional values arise from mathematical calculation
Round to nearest integer for practical interpretation
Model is simplification of reality
